locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the universality of judgment and the radical nature of grace using anecdotes of a woman with AIDS, secular friends (Sally and John), and the homeless crisis in NYC.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong. Connects the 'strong/weak' tension in Romans 14 to modern social and spiritual hierarchies.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher moves from asserting the reality of judgment to declaring the promise of justification by faith.
voorbeelden: We will all stand before the judgment seat of God.
This amazing promise comes true in ways that we are not able to force or predict.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To strip the hearer of self-righteousness and lead them to trust in the external promise of Christ.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The preacher notes God working 'in my sleep,' suggesting a work beyond human control.

voorbeelden: Paul writes, 'Each of us will give an account of himself to God.'
I read recently of a young woman who has the AIDS virus.
Why do you judge your brother?
Why do you look down on your brother?
I suppose, though it is hard for me to imagine...
I am convinced more than ever of two things.
As far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our sins from us.
The Lord will not always accuse us.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High. The preacher uses the 'Toezegging' (Promise) as the climax of the sermon.

voorbeelden: Whatever your sin... the Lord will not always accuse us.
This unlooked-for... declaration of mercy is the only hope we have.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate. The preacher relies on the 'news' of the Gospel rather than a direct 'I absolve you'.

indicatoren: Extensive storytelling about Sally and John
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed and intellectually engaged before the address becomes personal.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer receives the promise but as a general 'news' rather than a direct sacramental act.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Strongly anchored in the text of Psalm 103 and Romans 5.
voorbeelden: Whatever your failures... the Lord will not always accuse us.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal anecdotes and shared struggle ('I have been thinking').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct confrontation ('How many have you helped?') and comfort ('Whatever your failures').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used effectively in the final third to apply the promise.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the AIDS patient, Sally, John, and the Romans.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance that is bridged only in the conclusion.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General theological truths about God's nature.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'now' of the Gospel message being heard.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Avoids the trap of 'God is love, so be nice.'

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Judgment is real) -> Commissive (God promises mercy) -> Directive (Live in humorous patience).
voorbeelden: The Lord will not always accuse us... in the Christian community, the mercy of God is enacted each day.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Excellent transition from the indicative of grace to the imperative of community life.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Our lives... are enactments of the coming future... which depends exclusively on the overwhelming prodigality of God’s mercy.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon moves beyond information to a 'declaration of mercy' that aims to change the hearer's status before God.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Whatever your failures... the Lord will not always accuse us.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The first 500 words are almost entirely anecdotal.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon successfully shifts from 'talking about' judgment to 'proclaiming' the end of judgment.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The focus on the 'external word' of the promise makes it a means of grace.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, God is the one who 'makes the move' and 'has to do it'.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, the preacher speaks 'the news as if for the first time'.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Implicitly, through the 'unlooked-for' nature of change.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the preacher acknowledges that we cannot 'force' the promise.
tekstueel_bewijs: God had done that in my sleep, so to speak.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon is treated as the 'enactment of God's special regard'.
tekstueel_bewijs: This unlooked-for, undeserved, unimaginable declaration of mercy...

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on past-tense assertives in the beginning, but finishes with high-impact commissives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Lord will not always accuse us.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In the name of Jesus, the Lord does not accuse you today.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth to a direct declarative event.

voorbeeldzinnen: He has submitted to the Judgment in your place.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: The 'Sally and John' section is a bit long for a 'talking about' mode.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Integrate the 'you' earlier into the narrative.
voorbeeldzinnen: Like Sally, you might feel you don't need it.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in moving from the 'constative' reality of human failure to the 'performative' reality of Divine grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: Unlike SvT, which would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about the grudge, SAT focuses on the 'Declaration' that removes the sin.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power here is not in the AIDS anecdote's pathos, but in the 'Commissives' of Psalm 103.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's 'event' character is found in the final three paragraphs where the language shifts from 3rd person description to 2nd person address.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The Lord will not always accuse us.
We will all stand before the judgment seat of God.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High - establishes the need for the performative word.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of the 'Sacramental Pattern' where the indicative of the Gospel (the promise) provides the only ground for the imperative (the life of the church).
